courseDescription: This course is designed to support the continued training and development of piano skills needed in the elementary, secondary choral, and private vocal studio setting. This course is only for Bachelor of Music, Music Education majors in the Vocal, Guitar, or Keyboard concentration.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Teaching and mentoring in a studio setting

courseTitle: Freshman Seminar 1 for Music Education Students
courseDescription: This course is designed to help students make the most out of their experience as a student at ODU, create a sense of community among music education majors, and prepare students for the expectations of being a college student in the Diehn School of Music.

courseTitle: Freshman Seminar II for Music Education Students
courseDescription: This course provides a professional community for emerging music educators. Discussion and fieldwork will focus on the application of instructional and learning strategies for guiding critical and creative music thinking, teaching and learning in a variety of music educational contexts.
Technical and Digital Skills: Guiding critical and creative music thinking
Teaching strategies in various music educational contexts
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication within the field of music education
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing and adapting learning strategies for music education
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and conducting fieldwork in music education
